lead_paragraph: Afghan and Pakistani government officials expect negotiations to continue, but pushed the start date back to sometime later this month.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and MUJIB MASHAL

headline.print_headline: Taliban Say They Won’t Attend Peace Talks, but Officials Aren’t Convinced
headline.main: Taliban Say They Won’t Attend Peace Talks, but Officials Aren’t Convinced

snippet: Afghan and Pakistani government officials expect negotiations to continue, but pushed the start date back to sometime later this month.
abstract: Taliban says it will not partake in upcoming multilateral peace talks in Pakistan, blaming recent offensives by American and Afghan forces; officials suggest militant group is bluffing to enhance its bargaining power.
